intro: Turnera corchorifolia, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a contrasting yellow center. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture with a slightly waxy surface. Turnera corchorifolia thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments.
